topic: Deep dive: _functools standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _functools standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: functools Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an in-depth analysis of the functools standard library module in Python 3.12+, highlighting its key features, functions, and usage scenarios.
key_points: functools is a built-in Python module that provides higher-order functions to solve common programming tasks more easily
It includes decorators, function wrappers, and utilities for reducing the number of method definitions needed in new types
Key functions include: lru_cache, partial, reduce, wraps, singledispatch, singledispatchmethod
Many of these functions are used to optimize performance, simplify code, or provide flexible dispatch mechanisms for user-defined operations

code_examples.code:
from functools import partial
add = partial(lambda x, y: x + y, 5)
result = add(3)

version_notes: Many of the functions in functools have been present since Python 3.0 or earlier, but some new features and optimizations were introduced in version 3.12
caveats: It's important to understand that using decorators and higher-order functions can make code more readable and efficient, but it can also lead to obfuscated or hard-to-understand code if not used judiciously
Always consider maintaining readability and avoiding unnecessary abstraction when applying the functions from functools
